com.fuse.anim

Class AnimatableBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fuse.anim.AnimatableBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatableBaseWithValue

    public class AnimatableBase
extends Object
    Base class for animations; takes care of interpolation, duration and delay but doesn't hold any animated _value_. Instead, it's designed as a base to animate different types of value like a single float, a 3D vector, a color, etc. etc. Concept is stolen from ofxAnimatable by armadillu; https://github.com/armadillu/ofxAnimatable/blob/master/src/ofxAnimatable.h Note that this class is not designed to be used directly, should be extended instead; see Animatable class
    Author:
    mark

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnimatableBase()
      Default constructor; initializes an idle animation default values: * Duration: 1.0 (seconds) * Delay: 0.0 * Curve: LINEAR
      AnimatableBase(CurveType type)
      Constructor which loads the same default values as the default constructor, but lets the caller specify the curve-type

      • AnimatableBase

        public AnimatableBase()
        Default constructor; initializes an idle animation default values: * Duration: 1.0 (seconds) * Delay: 0.0 * Curve: LINEAR

      • AnimatableBase

        public AnimatableBase(CurveType type)
        Constructor which loads the same default values as the default constructor, but lets the caller specify the curve-type
        Parameters:
        type - Curve type (easing) to use for this animation

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        Progresses the animation the specified amount of time. Triggers the startAnimatingEvent if this progression completes the delay duration Triggers the stopAnimatingEvent if this progression completes the animation duration (by calling the finish() method, which call the stop() method)
        Parameters:
        dt - DelaTime; amount of time to progress the animation (in seconds)

      • getProgress

        public float getProgress()
        Returns:
        float A value between 0.0 (zero; still at beginning) and 1.0 (one; completed)

      • getCurveValue

        public float getCurveValue()
        Returns:
        float This animation's curve-type-specific value for the current progress value

      • getDuration

        public float getDuration()
        Returns:
        float The animation's duration in seconds

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(float newDuration)

        Parameters:
        newDuration - New duration in seconds

        public void setCurveType(CurveType type)
        Let the caller update the curve type (for easing) for the animation
        Parameters:
        type - The type of curve to use, se the CurveType enum
